result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph A Kelley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Possession of Controlled Substance [Modifiers: Penalty When None Expressed-Misdemeanor], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant, Joseph A Kelley, appeared. Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called: 15CM367 & 15CM103.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant plead no contest to Cts 1 & 2 of 15CM103 and 15CM367.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was enterered.  In 15CM103 Court dismissed but read in Cts. 3,4,5,6,7,8,9,10, and 11.  Court withheld sentencing on Cts. 1 & 2, placed defendant on probation for 2 years.  Conditions of probation include:  AODA and comply, restitution in the amount of $763.13 and surcharge, Ct. 1 $443.00 costs, and Ct. 2 $243.00 costs. Submit DNA sample  In 15CM367 Court dismissed but read in Ct. 3.  Court withheld sentencing on Cts. 1 & 2, placed defendant on probation for 2 years.  Conditions of probation include:  AODA and comply, restitution in the amount of $506.98 plus surcharge, Ct. 1 10 days jail with Huber for work release, and $443.00 costs.  Ct. 2 $243.00 costs.  Submit DNA sample.  No credit.  Jail start on 1-8-16 7pm.  Report to probation by 4 pm on 11-10-15.
